Description: Terracotta female figure. Fragment of 'Archaic Greek' figure holding a dove against her chest. She wears a chiton. Her hair falls onto her shouldars in long tresses. Light red clay with grey core. No paint remains. Fragment of upper left torso only.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Identification based upon unpublished registers and Edgars catalogue, where he cites British Museum Catalogue and Hogarths report (Higgins 1954; Hogarth et al. 1905). Thumbnail photograph not clear.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.415) (Phase 3)
